page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: The population of the area depend on only one road. Lower down the valley, this road tends to follow the river. Just after crossing the river via Peggy Bell's Bridge the road rises towards the hill-farms of Greenside hill and Hartside. During the winter this latter section of the road can be difficult because of snow. In places there are snow-fences but many of these are run-down. The council-owned road ends at Hartside. Beyond Hartside an identical but private road extends just over a mile to Linhope. A gate marks the boundary between the two roads. Also at Hartside, another private road leads down to Alnham-moor farm on the way to Bleakhope. This becomes a high-level road which is often blocked by snow in winter.
